segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to transmit general processing indicators and to specify loss or event details.

segment.documentation: GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the whole message.
FTX, A segment to give free format text regarding type of participation, type of risk, cause of loss, consequence of loss.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify relevant parties for the whole transaction.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the name and address and the related function of the party involved.
PCD, A segment to specify the producing or the placing intermediary's or broker's order percentage in the reinsurance, and to give the reinsurer's share in this intermediary's or broker's order.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom the communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.
RFF, A segment to specify the references of the party identified in the leading NAD segment.
GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the consequence of loss.
FTX, A segment to provide the ceding company details, leading reinsurer's comments, claimant information.
DTM, A segment to give information dates regarding claimants in medical malpractice.
UNS, A segment placed at the start of the detail section to avoid segment collision.
DTM, A segment to specify pertinent dates and periods relating to the RECLAM.
FTX, A segment to provide free format information regarding the loss, the risk or the reinsurance contract. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to provide information concerning the loss or event, and the reinsurance contract.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to provide references concerning the loss or event, reinsurance contract detail references, and for attached documents.
DTM, A segment to specify the transaction date of the attached document or message.
COM, A segment to identify the means by which the attached document or message was transmitted.
FTX, A segment to provide free text regarding the document or message that is being referenced.
LOC, A segment to identify the geographical scope to which the loss pertains.
MOA, A segment to specify the possible maximum loss amount.
PCD, A segment to specify the possible maximum loss as a percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify the class, line or sub-line of business.

segment.documentation: GIS, A segment to give a processing indicator relating to the policy breakdown.
RFF, A segment to specify references of the original insurance policy contract.
LOC, A segment to identify the geographical scope to which the risk pertains.
DTM, A segment to give the original insurance policy effective period.
FTX, A segment used to provide additional free text information about the policy effective period, the whole policy contract and the class or line of business.
PCD, A segment used to give the percentage of the original insurance policy contract ceded to one or more reinsurance contract(s).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify the amounts of the original insurance policy contract in three non-equivalent currencies.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify the appropriate non-equivalent currency being used to report the amounts in the original insurance policy contract section.
GIS, A segment to indicate whether the following amounts are annuities.
FTX, A segment to provide additional free text information regarding the annuities.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to provide all the information regarding amounts and converted amounts of the original insurance policy contract.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the amounts of the original insurance policy contract.
GIS, A segment to provide the entries expression flag.
CUX, A segment to specify the reference and target currencies and the rate of exchange, in case a currency conversion is required.
FTX, A segment to provide free text information regarding policy contract amounts.
PCD, A segment to specify the cedent's share percentage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to identify the parties involved in the original insurance policy section.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the name and address and the related function of the party involved.
PCD, A segment to give the percentage in the original insurance policy of the party identified in the leading NAD segment.
UNS, A segment used to prevent collision between the detail and the summary sections of the message. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify the amounts of the reinsurance contract in three non-equivalent currencies.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify the appropriate non-equivalent currency used to report the amounts in the reinsurance contract section.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to provide all the information related to the amounts and their currency conversion for the reinsurance contract.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the amounts of the reinsurance contract.
PCD, A segment to specify the reinsurer's share percentage or the applicable reinsurance contract retention.
CUX, A segment to specify the reference and target currencies and the rate of exchange, in case a currency conversion is required.
FTX, A segment to provide free text information regarding the reinsurance contract amounts.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to make reference to previous loss notifications in case an aggregate deductible is applicable.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the reference number of the previous loss notification.
DTM, A segment to specify the date of transaction of the supporting document or message.
COM, A segment to identify the means by which the referenced document or message was transmitted.
FTX, A segment to provide free text regarding the referenced document or message.
GIS, A segment to provide the entries expression flag at reinsurance contract level.
